title.rendered: AqualisBraemar LOC CEO to speak at SpareBank1 Energy Conference

content.rendered:
AqualisBraemar LOC CEO David Wells will address the SpareBank 1 Markets 2021 Digital Energy Conference on the 18th of February on offshore wind project development. 

SpareBank1’s annual energy conference is the leading Nordic investor conference for oil & gas and renewable energy and is a fixture in the Nordic finance and energy sectors. Due to the global pandemic, the 2021 Energy Conference in Oslo 17-18 February will be a digital affair.

“This is the second year we have been invited to discuss offshore wind and our place in it. With the acquisition of LOC late last year, creating a leading global energy and marine consultancy that serves the renewables, maritime and oil and gas sectors, we have created a leading capability in offshore wind.” Stated David Wells, AqualisBraemar LOC. “From early project development, designing and providing R&D for new floating technology, owners engineering fixed and floating projects, de-risking construction and installation with our marine warranty service and providing technical due diligence for investors and lenders; AqualisBraemar LOC support clients right across the offshore wind value chain. I am looking forward to discussing our business alongside such an august panel.”

Click here to register for this event.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar to acquire LOC Group
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar ASA has entered into an agreement to acquire 100 percent of the shares in LOC Group, thereby creating a leading global independent offshore energy and marine consultancy.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Acquisition of LOC Group completed
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar ASA has successfully completed the acquisition of 100 percent of the shares in LOC Group, thereby creating a leading global independent offshore energy and marine consultancy.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC expands offshore wind offering
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Renewables consultancy firm OWC sets up its own energy yield assessment service capability for offshore wind projects, providing an additional integrated service offering to developers.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Ambiens and OWC team up for Polish offshore wind developments
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has signed a memorandum of understanding with Polish environmental consulting firm Ambiens to cooperate on offshore wind developments in Poland.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar supports UN Global Compact
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: By signalling this intent, AqualisBraemar commits to making the UN Global Compact, and its principles, part of the strategy, culture and day-to-day operations of the company, and to engage in collaborative projects which advance the broader development goals of the United Nations, particularly its sustainable development goals.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC ramps up major wind project offering
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has appointed Scott Sutherland to the newly created role of director of major projects, in charge of growing the company’s project management services for fixed and floating wind projects.
